intro: Selago diosmoides, commonly known as the slender selago, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Selago diosmoides is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
